summary:
The Cosmos is a replacement texture for the skyrimgalaxy.dds texture file. This is a not a lore friendly mod, this is a fantasy mod, which aims to add some beauty to the vanilla night sky.

For an even more beautiful night sky, pair my mod with Vibrant Auroras by SparrowPrince.

Update: Now with 6k (original) and 4k versions.
descriptionHtml:
[URL=http://s150.photobucket.com/user/Blue-Bolt/media/Skyrim/cosmos-title-slide.jpg.html][IMG]http://i150.photobucket.com/albums/s86/Blue-Bolt/Skyrim/cosmos-title-slide.jpg~original[/IMG][/URL]

The Cosmos replaces the default Skyrim galaxy with a a new hi-res texture that is compromised of over 20 photographs (nebulas and galaxies) taken by the Hubble telescope. I blended them together to create a fantasy cosmos of color and light to make Skyrim nights more beautiful.

Note: The Cosmos will vary in appearance, according to your lighting conditions. Any ENB or lighting mods will affect how the night sky appears on your system. 

Recommended: For an even more beautiful night sky, pair my mod with Vibrant Auroras by SparrowPrince.

[URL=http://s150.photobucket.com/user/Blue-Bolt/media/Skyrim/cosmos-title-1.jpg.html][IMG]http://i150.photobucket.com/albums/s86/Blue-Bolt/Skyrim/cosmos-title-1.jpg~original[/IMG][/URL]

I realize that this level of eye candy, isn\'t for everyone, so don\'t say I didn\'t warn you. This is my very first mod, so please be tolerant of my efforts to bring something new to the Skyrim experience.

This file is quite large, so be aware that it can take some time to download.

[URL=http://s150.photobucket.com/user/Blue-Bolt/media/Skyrim/eowyn_cosmos.jpg.html][IMG]http://i150.photobucket.com/albums/s86/Blue-Bolt/Skyrim/eowyn_cosmos.jpg~original[/IMG][/URL]

Installation: Use NMM, or to do manually, merely unzip the file and install it into your Data folder in your Skyrim game folder.

The file path is  [C]Windows > Programs Files or Program Files (x86) > Steam > SteamApps > common > Skyrim > Data > Textures > Sky

Uninstall: Deactivate with NMM, or just manually delete (or overwrite) the skyrimgalaxy.dds file.

Enjoy!

This mod may not be posted to others sites, or used for other mods without my permission.
author: Gamwich
